website_summaries.verdict: The perfect size for coffee in small amounts; the one to choose for minimal coffee drinkers or campsite brewing, though the handle requires caution.
pros: A basic, compact percolator that can brew strong coffee
Its 6-cup capacity is ideal for preventing waste
cons: Even though the wooden handle is supposedly insulated, some owners report that it gets hot to the touch
The lid and hinge are flimsy

customer_reviews.title: Plastic perk knob
customer_reviews.text: Why....WHY would you ruin what seems to be a wonderful product with a cheap PLASTIC TOP??!! For me the whole point of using this is to AVOID heated plastic such as you get with drip makers. Now I have to wait an additional 5 days (with prime but it's weekend) until I can use my new perk. Not to mention having to buy a glass replacement top has just taken the half way decent price up an additional $6!!! NOT IMPRESSED. It does however seem to be of good quality otherwise. I will update my review when I can actually use this.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Great with only one flaw.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for the household with one coffee drinker. Sturdy, well made. The only negative is that it's a plastic knob. When I bought it I was under the impression I could remove the plastic knob and add my own glass knob.. but you can't do it, it is permanently fixed to the lid. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: alv

customer_reviews.title: Good little coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: This pot is great for the RV, camping ect. It does not have little parts like a spring you could loose. It holds just three mugs of coffee, use your mug to measure the water as you make the coffee. I use one slightly rounded tablespoon of coffee grounds per each mug of coffee I plan to make. I also use one tablespoon of cold water over coffee grounds per each tablespoon of grounds used. This pot perks very quickly. Only drawback I see is it is just a bit small for the price. It cleans easy and works well.
customer_reviews.author: FarmGirl

customer_reviews.title: st the plastic top is perfectly fine, next any handle on any teapot or coffee ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband and he absolutely loves it! I have seen comments in regards to the plastic top and the wooden handle. !st the plastic top is perfectly fine, next any handle on any teapot or coffee pot on the stove is going to get hot, use common sense use a glove to remove it.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy M Ripley

customer_reviews.title: Sprang a leak after four camping trips
customer_reviews.text: Even though it wasn't the most economical candidate, we purchased this stainless steel Chinook coffee percolator to use for occasional camping trips. We were pleased until our fifth trip, when it sprang a pinhole leak on the bottom edge. We had not damaged or dented the coffeepot in any way, and we wrote to Chinook to say we believe it had a manufacturing defect. We enclosed our original invoice and asked for a replacement. We never heard a word in response.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine B.

customer_reviews.title: Tough Steel, Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: I took my new percolator camping last week and it was exactly what I wanted. I used a propane stove but this coffee pot is heavy enough to use on a campfire. It brews just 3 cups, enough for a mug and a top off. Get the 3-1/2" round filters.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and it brews coffee perfectly every time
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and it brews coffee perfectly every time. I've used this a lot so far and am planning on using it a lot more! I have even used it on my kitchen stove a few times when I want that "camp coffee" flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little percolator
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect little coffee maker! My husband didn't care for the electric perks as they didn't make a small amount of coffee well or at all. This one will give him the amount he wants and he can perk it for the amount of time he likes. We don't have any downside to it. He puts in water to the 4 cup level and grounds for 2 cups. That makes just over 1 good mug of coffee. We like the attached lid. No problems with cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brown

customer_reviews.title: I can see it denting very easily. That being said
customer_reviews.text: All stainless, however the pot itself is rather thin material and the only reason I couldn't give it 5 stars. I can see it denting very easily. That being said, it's probably the best basket design I've seen. Very few grounds in the coffee and the basket is tight in the pot. No rattling around. Most importantly....it makes awesome coffee! Nothing like perked coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Little Stovetop Percolator!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little percolator, but you do have to avoid setting your stove too high, or your coffee will have a burned taste when it is finsihed brewing. Set the temperate on "high" and immediately turn it down to #2 or #3 when it starts to brew, and see how it tastes after it has brewed for 5 minutes. This percolator makes about 2 large cups of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Renee B.

customer_reviews.title: perfect for 1
customer_reviews.text: As described, fast shipping. A little small for 2 people, but, perfect for 1! Don't overfill with water,and honestly, works best between the two water measurements.
customer_reviews.author: richard deen

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle camping trip saved by coffee
customer_reviews.text: This little guy worked perfectly with my white box alcohol stove for a 2 week trip. Make sure you get either perc filters or coarse grind coffee if you can't handle a bit of grounds in the cup.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: This oercolator
customer_reviews.text: Description SPECIFICALLY says it holds 48 ounces but this is not true. It holds 6 ‘coffee sized’ cups which are 6 oz each. I neasured and it us 36 oz to the 6 cup line. I am very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Heath

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Percor
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for two good-size cups of coffee. Stainless pot has good gauge metal and feel very solid. Top is resin/plastic and I replaced it with glass immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Lid doesn't fit properly on basket
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, the lid doesnt stay securely on the basket and you either have 1)grounds mixed with coffee or 2)a pot boiling over. I love perked coffee and was very disappointed. As it is now, I just use it to make "cowboy coffee"-thst is, boiling water with the grounds and pouring it through a fine mesh strainer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, simple, stainless steel percolator for 1-3 people.
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on time in excellent condition. Works as expected—makes good coffee, easy to clean, and good for home or camping. Handle can get hot, so be careful. Makes a minimum of 11 oz coffee up to a maximum of about 20 oz.
customer_reviews.author: BlueR

customer_reviews.title: Good quality percolator
customer_reviews.text: Quality product. Just follow the instructions and make good coffee. Use it on hunting and camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: blp3

customer_reviews.title: Really good coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I recommend you read Microjoe's review. He about covers everything and is the reason I bought this. I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars because it is made in China, and I never rate something made there with 5. I had my first cup of noncoffeemaker coffee in years this morning. I had forgotten how good coffee can taste.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Vade Bon Coeur

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee and unforgettable memories.
customer_reviews.text: Love my little coffee pot, takes my back to the days when dad and I drank coffee on the back porch early in the mornings made by dad's little drip pot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does what the ad says.  You just have to know what you're doing.
customer_reviews.text: It's works fine, I just haven't been able to figure out the perfect timing yet. It also works on an induction cooker, but it's a little harder to get the right amount to heat. I would give it more stars but I'm not sure if I'm at fault for determining when the coffee is ready or it's a bit inconsistent. I find a french press much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Deck

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for camper, with a little practice makes the best coffee
customer_reviews.author: Tommie Hughes

customer_reviews.title: It  is small.
customer_reviews.text: It is small. It makes coffee. Good for 2 persons going camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and this little guy is perfect size!
customer_reviews.text: We fly into a lake in Canada every year, and every year we are fighting to put a workable coffee pot together with what the outpost supplies. No more, time to take in our own, and this little guy is perfect size!
customer_reviews.author: M. Hale

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee maker for outdoor use
customer_reviews.text: Good coffee maker for outdoor use. I used it on a camping trip and the coffee came out better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Toan Tieu

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT pot for 2 mugs of coffee. I use it for my overland trips. PERFECT size
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Best 4-6 cup percolator
customer_reviews.text: The quickest coffee made, within four minutes!!!. Taste great, no grains. BEST COFFEE I EVER BOUGHT. Much needed during this pandemic 👌🏽
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: very good quality.
customer_reviews.text: perfect size! Hard to find the 5 cup these days works great great quality.Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The lid does not close tightly, so spill hot ...
customer_reviews.text: The lid does not close tightly, so spill hot water and coffee, spoiling the stove top. Seller agreed the defect but failed to replace with new one yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with this coffee maker. It is very well made and durable. Best cup of coffee I have had in years. The only thing I recommend is to replace the plastic percolator top with a glass one.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Meek

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: when i got it the lid had a gap about 6mm. i was going to return or request a discount for defective product. I brewed at 6cups to see if it will spill, it did not. worked fine i then twisted the lid at the hing and that fixed the gap issue, it lay flat. the nob is acrylic not glass. i prefer to use fine ground coffee, so i use a filter for small coffee makers.
customer_reviews.author: sr

customer_reviews.title: Bought for camping, but now use in home as well
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this for our camping supplies. It works great to make a nice hot cup of coffee on brisk mornings. I've always wet the metal 'basket' before putting in grinds and had very little end up down in the coffee. Following guidelines on here, I let it percolate for about seven minutes. Clean up has been a breeze and we haven't found anything wrong with it. It makes great coffee and I use it at home when I want some bold coffee and don't mind waiting.
customer_reviews.author: T. Deschenes

customer_reviews.title: makes a good cup of coffee if filled correctly
customer_reviews.text: This coffee pot worked exactly as I had hoped it would. Brews correctly, makes a good cup of coffee if filled correctly, and puts out a nice hot cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Slader

customer_reviews.title: it's shiny!!
customer_reviews.text: Just the right amount of coffee to get my day started..
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: small and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Overall I love my small percolator accept for the lid, the way it open. Swing lid, wish it could just come off when cleaning you have to be careful that you don't break it off.
customer_reviews.author: Ada Young

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: It broke the third time I tried to use. It's a cheap piece of sh*t
customer_reviews.author: TwistedTwerp

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR ONE
customer_reviews.text: Got this percolator because my old Sunbeam Vaculator isn't working anymore. It's the perfect size for coffee for one, easy to clean up, and appears to be pretty much indestructible. A glass percolator bowl instead of plastic would have gotten it a fifth star, but the plastic one is likely to last longer. Small enough to take motorcycle camping, big enough for that weekend cup o' joe, and the price was right at less than thirty bucks to my doorstep. If I had a significant other who really liked coffee, this might be too small.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the wife and I when we go camping ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the wife and I when we go camping and have to have that cup of coffee in the morning. Classic easy to use. If not using a paper filter grind the coffee coarsely.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Carattini

customer_reviews.title: Makes my coffee great, but then again, that depends on me!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little perculator! I got this one for when I don't want too much coffee leftover. It works wonderfully and my coffee always tastes good (of course, that mostly depends on me, haha)
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Neat little coffee maker. Good for living single or camping.
customer_reviews.author: sm

customer_reviews.title: A cute, great coffee percolator.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. There is no delicate glass thing to break, you make coffee with fire, and it tastes great. Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Efrain M.

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite
customer_reviews.text: The size and construction of this coffee pot is right on the money. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mal

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It makes great coffee on an electric stove. It’s easy to clean and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Pletcher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price as everything is stainless steel including the basket. Although the perk top is plastic, that's an advantage as it will probably never break or need replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Bodd

customer_reviews.title: Both versions have plastic domes!
customer_reviews.text: I thought, based on other reviews, that the stainless steel percolator would have a glass dome. I was wrong. Very clearly plastic. Came assembled incorrectly and I had to fix it. The hinge also seems very weak - if it doesn't break in a month I'll be fine with spending money on this.
customer_reviews.author: AGM

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit for camping, it ia nicely made, only found one sharp edge on it but that was taken care of with a nail file. The metal is a good thickness not cheep at all. It is large enough for morning coffee for two as long as you don't drink more that a large coffee cup each. If you want more look at a bigger unit.
customer_reviews.author: handyman

customer_reviews.title: Chinook Timberline 6 Cup Stainless Steel Coffee Percolator
customer_reviews.text: These are durable standard percolators. I purchased two sizes of these. One for the house and a smaller one for camping. They are ALL stainless with a hardwood covered handle that can take repeated washings in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: WT

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not good quality already leaks from spout seams, save your money and buy something better
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Braganza

customer_reviews.title: Good for mobile devices and camping.
customer_reviews.text: This was not what I wanted. It require a heat source other than electric.
customer_reviews.author: marguerite wolfem

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee! Especially when camping
customer_reviews.text: Makes great coffee! Especially when camping. Sturdy and would even be pretty on the stovetop. However will not replace the convenience of my Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Pat (Sequim, Wa)

customer_reviews.title: I had a pot like this that was 15yrs old I bought when I ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a pot like this that was 15yrs old I bought when I returned to work I was so afraid I wouldn't find a comparable one well this is actually a little better made.. Excellent
customer_reviews.author: Margaret LaRosa

customer_reviews.title: Best pot around.
customer_reviews.text: Perked coffee is the best. If you want good coffee, this is the pot to get.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Menkin

customer_reviews.title: This has taken over my electric coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: Liked the idea of an all metal coffee pot, works well on the stove and camp fire grill
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Odlum

customer_reviews.title: Works great, needs better handle
customer_reviews.text: It works great as advertised. My only complaint is that the wood handle, which is a nice feature, started coming apart already on the second use.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love my little pot! Just enough for a couple of days!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: love it we drive a lot from Nashville to maine ...
customer_reviews.text: love it we drive a lot from Nashville to maine at rest stops we pull out the colmen and perk coffee gives us time to rest and coffee pot works excelent
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer pete 615

customer_reviews.title: Works like it says it would
customer_reviews.text: Works like it says it would. Great size for personal use, would get a larger one for camping with a group. I would buy another one if I needed another peculator.
customer_reviews.author: Howdyb

customer_reviews.title: perked perfection
customer_reviews.text: as a fan of perked coffee, I decided it was time to replace my 40 year old stovetop percolator. I am very pleased with this model. it is the right size for me to make 2 good sized mugs of coffee. the handle has adequate distance from the body of the percolator and is of a wooden material to ensure that there is no danger of it heating up. pouring is easy. cleaning is easy. and the coffee is hot. what more can one expect from a simple kitchen gadget.
customer_reviews.author: beach girl

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Loveeeeee it coffee tastes way better in this pot than the machine
customer_reviews.author: nuha

customer_reviews.title: Feels like Old School
customer_reviews.text: This is really a nice pot to have. It's just as fast and cheaper than my Kuerig. I bought this because my Kuerig works when it wants to. Using the Kuering usually takes about 1/2 an hour to get the damn thing to work. It started going on the blink after 2 months of using it and the inserts are so expensive. For a box you pay between 10 to 15 dollars. I love my Chinook! it's an old fashioned way to make coffee...real coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Queentasingtao

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes the traditional way is the better way.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Keurig, and a 12 cup auto drip coffee maker... But I wanted a simple solution to my problem - how can I make a robust dark-brewed batch (two large mugs), of coffee? The Keurig delivers consistency but an average cup of coffee, a bit on the weak side (regardless of blend). The 12 cup pot is wasteful and takes more time to setup. The Chinook Timberline is an inexpensive way to make just the amount of coffee I want from my home ground beans brewed to perfection (amount of time you perk). It is not fancy. It is not "machined to the highest standards". It is a simple old fashioned solution that works.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Macaluso

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!!!
customer_reviews.text: We Love this coffee maker! It Packs away so easily, we use it often, it's easy to clean, fits our needs well!
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: i think it's kind of overhyped. the handle is very poorly insulated (some wood on a thin piece of steel) and requires caution when taking off of the burner because it is scalding water in there for crying ... nevermind. for camping maybe it's OK but if you have a stove top in an RV you owe it to yourself to get something better
customer_reviews.author: JimTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Works well and seems to be well constructed. Plastic brewing knob on top could be better. I bought 6 cup, it's a little small so will be buying larger on soon. I do intend to larger size from this company
customer_reviews.author: Miki Inc

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: the lid keeps coming detached. Otherwise, i'd give it a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: T. M.

customer_reviews.title: Well made coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: Look's and feel's like a good well made pot,I would gave It 5 stars,but it had a crack in the handle bottom hole.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lo Bosco

customer_reviews.title: Neat, works great
customer_reviews.text: Great working percolator, coffee tastes excellent! Small enough yet practical, easy to clean up and carry along for any type of trip.
customer_reviews.author: M&B

customer_reviews.title: I like it so much I'm thinking of ordering another one ...
customer_reviews.text: Loves this. Well made. My only complaint is it's little hard to read the measurements inside. However, I like it so much I'm thinking of ordering another one for my RV.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great coffee percolator
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a percolator that was not too big and this is perfect! I will probably order an extra glass top.
customer_reviews.author: BeeBonn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: have this coffee pot in the 2-3 cup and love it so I ordered the bigger one
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few weeks ago and I have now used it about 4 times. I wanted something long lasting that I could used to brew coffee for a few people when I go camping. I have now used it on the stove-top and on charcoal to make coffee. It percolates coffee and seems to work fine. It seems sturdy. It is easy to clean. The wooden handle is nice although it can still get too hot to touch. At this point I would recommend the product to others. I will update this review if I have any problems in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo6767

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I love making my coffee in this pot every morning. It is just as described. As soon as it begins perking, I turn the eye down med/low and let it per until I see the desired strength. Best Coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Faythe

customer_reviews.title: Slightly disappointed with the misinformation given on this product
customer_reviews.text: Slightly disappointed with the misinformation given on this product. I read in the Q&A section that it had a GLASS dome but in actual fact it is PLASTIC. BPA-free or not, it is still plastic. I would have returned this if my current perculator glass dome didn't fit on this Chinook perc. Works great but the information on this product needs to be updated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought to use in our camper
customer_reviews.text: We haven't used it yet, but it was the perfect size and we can use this without electricity so it will work out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fit into my Motorcycle saddlebag and it fits great. It perks just like a coffee pot should. I like the stainless steelness of it also.
customer_reviews.author: GFund

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for half of a pot
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for half of a pot. Filled to second line and coffee boiled over into grounds and onto stove. Grounds all in coffee. Useless at larger capacity.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is a high quality product and makes good, hot coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Monument

customer_reviews.title: great coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee pot that makes some of the best coffee I've had. I use it at hgome as well as camping. No more of that coffee machine coffee for me. Perked is a treat.
customer_reviews.author: B. Foster

customer_reviews.title: This pot works good
customer_reviews.text: Not a ton to say about the product.. The pot works great, wooden handle guard so you don't get burnt, stainless steel inside and out and seems to be well constructed. The coffee percolates well and comes out VERY HOT and flavorful... After using this I wish I would have gotten the bigger pot..
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I would like is a better handle on the coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I would like is a better handle on the coffee pot. I keep on burring my hand.
customer_reviews.author: john albert

customer_reviews.title: not all stainless steel??
customer_reviews.text: This makes good coffee, and functions well as a percolator - but I spent a lot more on it compared to other brands because it said stainless steel. I don't believe the basket inside is stainless steel - so what's the point? The button on top is plastic also. It works, but if you're after very high quality materials this might not be the one for you. The handle is clad in wood which adds a nice rustic touch and makes it easier to handle off the stove which is one good feature.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it. I upgraded from the cheap aluminum version ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this for camping on our camper stove top. Absolutely love it. I upgraded from the cheap aluminum version when the parts inside bent and broke. This is very sturdy and makes great coffee. It's definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: TashaMD

customer_reviews.title: Stove top percolator.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these stove top percolators [Chinook Timberline 6 Cup] for use in my Airstream trailer; It has worked so well that we bought a second one for use in our house.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERTSUNRUS

customer_reviews.title: Plastic top!!?!!
customer_reviews.text: Why would a company offer their higher priced stainless steel coffee percolator with a plastic top and their lower priced aluminum coffee percolator with a glass top? Makes no sense.
customer_reviews.author: Jillaby

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in NJ
customer_reviews.text: If I had kept the paper work for this pot, I would have returned it. When the coffee is boiling, the coffee pot top does not close tight, so the coffee spills out all over the stove. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: diane spontac

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Needed a good stove top pot for the boat. This fits the bill nicely! So enjoy a real cup of fresh brew!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: ... the other but the quality and made is far better..
customer_reviews.text: a little more expensive than the other but the quality and made is far better...
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: This is really well made. Worked great on its first camp.
customer_reviews.author: SEH

customer_reviews.title: Handle is hot.
customer_reviews.text: It makes good coffee, but unless your hands are much smaller than mine (and mine are small) the metal parts above the wood on the handle are hot...like hot enough to cause a burn. I obviously now use a oven mitt.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Guest

customer_reviews.title: but I don't like it and have set it aside for emergency only
customer_reviews.text: Arrived soon. But the inside part, the "stem" is damaged. It is lopsided and the bottom is twisted and does not sit flat. Have tried to use it but it shakes and rattles rather loud. Should send it back but it arrived with no papers for return. It can be used, but I don't like it and have set it aside for emergency only. Makes too much noise to be used while camping out.
customer_reviews.author: Vyra P. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Too large for me.
customer_reviews.text: It's too large. I need one that makes 2to 4 cups. I need to return this one and find one of the appropriate size.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Masella

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: While impressed that this is made of stainless steel, I was unimpressed with the fact that the lid doesn't fit right and is elevated slightly on the spout end. When it starts to perk the water and coffee comes out a little. I know percolators will have some coffee grounds in the bottom but this is just way to much. Going to buy and try some of those little round filters that fit inside. Overall - it works and the handle didn't get hot.
customer_reviews.author: Julie J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good coffee brewer- Percolates fast- don’t leave unattended. wipes clean... good coffee ☕️ pot✅.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: This one is great - large enough for me - coffee comes out ...
customer_reviews.text: Ahh this was my second choice for a perculator. The first was over priced - stem missing. This one is great - large enough for me - coffee comes out full bodied. Its the way I like it. ;- )
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Merrill

customer_reviews.title: I really do love it. It percolates
customer_reviews.text: I really do love it. It percolates ! Makes a nice little noise and the smell is fantastic. I am drinking some coffee from it now. The big deal is I can take it camping as well. A little bit of home will follow me. I don't need a "K-cup" or and electrical cord. The quality is superb ! Stainless with a wooden handle.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Connor

customer_reviews.title: All that it claims to be
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Sturdy. Holds up well. It was easy to use. No filters needed. We used it for camping and enjoyed hot coffee every morning. Simply fill the pot to the line with water, place the metal insert inside, minus the lid to the top chamber, fill the inside chamber with measured coffee grounds, place inside lid on top, replace top and set on heat to boil. When liquid in the top appears coffee colored, you are set. Careful when pouring to hold the top or you'll dump the coffee grounds in your cup! Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: B_Straiton

customer_reviews.title: This is a great percolator. made nicely
customer_reviews.text: This is a great percolator. made nicely. I would of gave it 5 stars if it came with a Glass dome instead of a plastic dome. Now i have to order a glass dome. . The reviews say the Glass domes brake to easy.>? Seems there is a issue with the Glass domes... Tell then 4 stars..
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great Pot!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Chinook we have bought. Sturdy and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. MORGAN

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: The Timberline Coffee Maker is a great product. I ordered it for my mother-in-law because she wanted a smallish stove top maker. This exceeded expectations and arrived quickly. Very happy with the product and service.
customer_reviews.author: lilngrey

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hard to clean but works as expected for camping without electricity.
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Coffee the old fashioned way
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what my Dad was looking for and nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

product_meta.title: Chinook 41115 Coffee Percolator, 6 Cup, Unknown
product_meta.description: The Timberline Coffee Percolator with its heavy gauge 18/8 polished stainless steel construction and heat insulating Perm wood handle makes perfect coffee at picnics, camp and home. This percolator has precision-fitting, seamless parts for brewing great coffee for years to come. Dishwasher-safe. Includes a quality storage sack with a draw cord closure. Specifications: - 6 Cup - Volume: 48 fl. oz. - Weight: 21 oz. - Percolator Only

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
